Tomorrow night (9/30) I’ll be speaking with R.J. Palacio, one of my favorite authors and humans, about her tremendous new book PONY. R.J. is the author of WONDER, one of my favorite books ever. Her new one is an instant classic. Sure to be a fun conversation. She’s so insightful, wise, and human. 5pm PST, 8pm EST. Link for tix is in my bio (and up in my stories) Join us!

Caption:

@carriebyalick commissioned this painting of Nelson The Dog from @thisiscarlybeck for my birthday and I couldn’t love it more. Was it hard to get Nelson in the jeans and T-shirt and to stand up and pose with his hands in his pockets for hours? You bet! But he did it anyway because he is the best dog. Also: he loves @radnorandlee. Thanks Carrie and Carly! And Happy One Year Anniversary to me and Nelson being best buds. My sister and I picked him up August 17, 2020. I was so scared to get a dog and now I can’t imagine my life without him. #nelson #nelsonthedog #nelsonnysideup

Did you know that it’s #nationalmiddlechildday? I didn’t either until my younger sister told me. I don’t have any tales of being the neglected middle child. Grateful every day to have grown up sandwiched between two of my favorite people (my sisters) Wouldn’t change a thing.

Caption:
joshradnor
Verified
My girlfriend got me this coat for my birthday. I love her and it (her way more than the coat but they’re both great.) Thanks to everyone for all the birthday wishes today. Aging is one of the trippier things required of humans. There’s some comfort in knowing everyone has to do it. I like so much about getting older and have zero desire to rewind the clock. Still, I’m startled to be forty-seven. Like I have no idea how that happened. But I’m convinced it's better to be here than not be here and hopefully I’ve got many more years ahead of me to reflect on how trippy it is to get older. Excited for what’s to come.

Please join me in wishing Nelson The Dog a happy birthday!! This little guy has been alive for one full year. He’s destroyed more pairs of headphones than I can count but it’s hard to stay mad at him. Look at that face (he hated that hat btw...) He’s upgraded my life in so many ways. We love you Nelson! Thanks for wearing humiliating hats to amuse us!! Hope you live for a hundred years!!! (expert 📷 work by @abigailspencer) #nelson #nelsonthedog #nelsonderthesea #happybirthdaynelson

sites.prh.com/pony
Caption:
joshradnor
Verified
A few weeks ago I was feeling down and I mentioned it to my friend @jonmarro. It’s not always easy for me to admit when I’m down and a lot of my healing around that has come through friendships where I feel safe and seen, where I trust that my lovability and worth are not dependent upon my being ‘up’ all the time. Jon’s one of those friends with whom I feel like I can show up exactly as I am. Anyway I mentioned I was down and he texted me the most glorious pep talk. I won’t share it here but I’ll just say it totally reoriented me. He reminded me who I was while also giving me permission to feel exactly how I felt. As some of you may know Jon is also my favorite artist and has done a ton of art for me over the years (movie posters, album covers, etc.) I asked him to design the cover for my EP and he came back with the design posted above. I ended up going with another cover but Jon’s pass at it is dear to my heart. All of which is to say, when you feel low and uninspired it’s great to have friends who see you as a forest mountain king.

Look at this! I’m so heartened by the response to my EP “One More Then I’ll Let You Go.” And grateful to all of you who’ve given these songs a spin (107,440 times on Spotify!!) in the two weeks since its release.
.
Big thanks to Ryan Dwyer at @flowermoonrecords for his savvy wisdom about putting things out in the world.
.
And to my creative collaborators: wunderkind producer @ryan_dilmore and ace violinist @kerenzapeacock.
.
Hope to take these songs and others on the road soon so I can thank you all face to face. Happy Friday. JR

sites.prh.com/pony
Caption:
joshradnor
Verified
So @nurse_tina_cle and @louis_louie just got married and #happythankyoumoreplease, the first movie I wrote and directed, played a big part in their courtship and their wedding. Super honored and congrats to you both! JR

****

We are both nurses and met almost eight years ago at work. On one of our first dates, I told him how I loved this movie, perhaps he hadn’t heard of it, ‘happy thank you more please.’ I told him how this concept, even just a line in this movie, really resonated with me. It brought up this need, especially working with people on the worst days of their life, in the hardest of situations, with the sickest of the sick, to find that glimmer of hope and to always carry this gratitude. And to say thank you. And if I’m so lucky, more please?
.
This idea has been a sweet touchstone in our relationship.
.
We have signed every love letter like this.
He engraved it in my engagement ring.
It is on my wedding invites.
It will be painted on my wedding veil.
.
I thought I would share that with you. That this movie made a big difference to me. And to us. So, thank you. More please? Xo, Tina
23w
